title: Dimitar Marashliev
text:
Dimitar Hristov Marashliev (; 31 August 1947 – 12 July 2018) was a <a href="Bulgaria">Bulgaria</a>n <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a> who played for <a href="Bulgaria%20national%20football%20team">Bulgaria</a> in the <a href="1970%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1970 FIFA World Cup</a>. He also played for <a href="PFC%20CSKA%20Sofia">CSKA Sofia</a>.
Career.
Born in <a href="Harmanli">Harmanli</a>, Marashliev began his football career playing for hometown club <a href="FC%20Hebros">Hebros</a> at the age of 13. He spent three years at the club before moving to <a href="FC%20Maritsa%20Plovdiv">Maritsa Plovdiv</a> in 1963. Three years later, Marashliev made his <a href="Bulgarian%20A%20Football%20Group">A Group</a> debut with <a href="FC%20Spartak%20Plovdiv">Spartak Plovdiv</a>, appearing in 6 league matches and scoring 2 times.
In October 1966, Marashliev joined <a href="PFC%20CSKA%20Sofia">CSKA Sofia</a>. In his ten years at the club, he won six <a href="Bulgarian%20A%20Football%20Group">A Group</a> titles and four <a href="Bulgarian%20Cup">Bulgarian Cup</a>s. Marashliev scored a total of 4 goals in three Bulgarian Cup finals – in <a href="1969%20Bulgarian%20Cup%20Final">1969</a> (one goal against <a href="PFC%20Levski%20Sofia">Levski Sofia</a>), <a href="1972%20Bulgarian%20Cup%20Final">1972</a> (two goals against <a href="PFC%20Slavia%20Sofia">Slavia Sofia</a>) and <a href="1974%20Bulgarian%20Cup%20Final">1974</a> (one goal against Levski Sofia).
After leaving CSKA at the end of the 1975–76 season, Marashliev joined <a href="PFC%20Cherno%20More%20Varna">Cherno More Varna</a>, scoring 8 goals in the <a href="Bulgarian%20B%20Professional%20Football%20Group">B Group</a>. He retired from competitive football at the end of the 1976–77 season, at the age of 30.
